area_name: Bouldering by the Roped Climbing (Holding Area)

content.description: Sit start with good left and right hands. Place a right heel toe cam and move up the face. Might be a bit height dependent.
content.location: This is the arete feature right as you walk into the middle of the talus. Up and right of the other overhung project.

content.description:
Red Storm Rising surfs up the side of one of the biggest boulders at Area 51. It starts on the far left side and works all the right to the apex of the boulder and tops out for a "true" ascent.  

  This route is very crimpy, with some sweet body tension and heel hooks. It never gets very tall, unless you consider the walk off top out.  

  It generally gets very dirty from all the trees around so a good brush and some elbow grease are essentials.
content.protection: Pad and spotters. Very safe with a good landing. Only a boulder on the fair right side of the right poses a threat.
content.location: after coming down the trail, you'll come across two bolted routes (end of the innocence, and curse of the drill). right behind these routes you'll see two very big boulders, one very tall and thin and one very large and wide. Red Storm Rising is on the fat wide one. It is on the left hand side of the boulder. I posted some beta pictures so you know what it looks like.

content.description: Start low on a horizontal finger crack and a juggy shelf. Work you way up to a balancy crimp at the crux before you top out. Be careful not to lose your balance as just around the corner of this boulder there is a shear drop about 20 feet.
content.protection: bring multiple crash pads as the landing is covered in boulders. I would also recommend a spotter for the side of this problem that has a drop.
content.location: As you arrive there is a free standing tower just before you approach the hollow. There is a mess of boulders built up behind the tower that leads to the base of this route. Start on the back side of the tower and work your way up the arete

content.description: Extremely crimpy route.  There are likely better holds buried beneath the moss but I figured it looked cool that way so only unearthed some crimps.  Only what is on the mossy face is on and anything else (to either side of the mass of moss or on the edges of it) is off.  If my memory is right there is only one hold (a microjug) after the start that isn't a crimp until the topout.  Start on two microjugs beneath horizontal crack - move up to edge directly beneath crack and work the crimps to the topout which consists of a big edge, a sharp little crimp/pinch, and a crimp higher on the little face perpendicular to and on top of Muckraker.
content.location: Mossy face just to the left of Hillbilly Highball.

content.description: Start on the horizontal crack on the biggest face of the Hillbilly Highball Boulder between the arete on the left and the big ledge on the right. Stay just to the right of the arete for most of the climb. Skip the jug on the right about two thirds up and everything on the volcanic looking bulge on the arete except for the pinch right at the top of it.  Top-out delicately on either of the two slopey holds at the top.  Crux is right at the start but it just gets scarier from their. Watch out for wildlife in the sideways finger pockets.
content.protection: A few pads: it is a highball after all
content.location: Very large boulder near Red Storm Rising, Curse of the Drill, and End of Innocence .  You really can't miss it.

content.description: Start with feet on the block below and hands on low left crimp and right sloper, work your way to the top. Would get more stars if not for lowball sit start.
content.location: Obvious line in the talus just out past the hollow. Right before the talus pit problems.

content.description: SDS on edges, move up and right and figure out a way to reach the good sloper jug. Try and climb this early in the day or you'll probably discover the name sake of the climb.
content.location: This climb is just around the corner of red storm rising on the same boulder

content.description: Start on the large ledge down and left on the overhang, continue up on edges and gun for the lip. Take the lip around the corner and up to the top.
content.location: Walk out past the hollow and scramble down and left. This and the thumbercling are tucked away between the talus.

pathTokens: Bouldering by the Roped Climbing (Holding Area)
